title: Mouse settings on macOS Sierra are different than El Capitan
body: After updating my OS to Sierra, I jumped into a game and my mouse didn't feel the same as the previous OS. Has anyone else had this isssue?

replies.body: Can you give me a bit more detail as to how it's different to you? I'd like to look into this a bit more.

Mouse keeps jumping to the middle of the screen after smart ping on mac OS Sierra.
Here's a youtube video to show it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=klXVa73BmqQ

Have you tried using different keys when smart pinging to see if this still happens? You should be able to bind the smartping key to another key as well inside the Hotkeys settings in-game.

Let me know if those change this behaviour.

Gotcha. I've heard a few different reports of mouse issues on macOS Sierra. I definitely recommend submitting a bug report on our [tracking boards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report) where we can keep an eye on this.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

Hey! I have exactly the same issue.. First I thought it was just me, but it makes it quite hard to play decent.. I do hope this can be fixed.. I also tried to change my mouse-settings like you did @CHADOWEN, but I still can't find something comfortable because the pointer keeps behaving oddly.

Hey there,

I've also noticed my mouse feeling slightly different in-game since upgrading to Sierra. It's one of those situations where it's difficult to exactly pin-point what is wrong (as so much is muscle memory at this point), but after a bit of testing I think I have a better idea of what is making the mouse feel 'off.'

There seems to be a slight delay in either curser movement or click response during times of rapid mouse motion. So, for example, if you're quickly moving the curser around the screen during a team fight to select various targets, the curser will have a super subtle delay on the screen and then jump to where it should be. It took a while for me to realize this due to how slight it is, but I believe this to be why everything feels a bit off.

I would be simply pulling stuff out of my butt in suggesting what is causing this, but probably something to do with how Sierra manages CPU intense programs/apps ( for reference, here â€“ http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/254143/macos-sierra-reducing-cpu-usage-of-processor-intensive-processes ).

So it's a bit of a bummer this is happening, but in the meantime I've just worked to adjust my mouse settings to off-set the problem a tad.
I've tried the same thing. Doesn't work for me. I hope you have better luck.
